history.content: I think you'll be fine. As long as you have fulfilled all the graduation requirements, you are no longer required to take a minimum number of units for letter grade, or otherwise.

children.subject: Confirm with an adviser, or just take one of those classes for a letter to be safe

history.content:
I'm a 4th year 2nd semester EECS student set to graduate after this semester, Spring 2019.  I'm currently fulfilling my last upper div humanities course this semester as PNP, which is the last class I need on my degree checklist to graduate (visited a counselor and verified this).  I'm currently only taking 2 additional CS courses this semester, but they're also both PNP.

Since my entire schedule is PNP, I'm assuming my semester GPA will basically be 0, so will I be put on academic probation and not be able to walk?

The policies and procedures page for CoE only mentions lifting restrictions for minimum units, but nothing about semester GPA for your degree term.  I'd like to assume I'll be fine but I'd like to dispel any uncertainties about it.  Thanks in advance!

https://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/policies-procedures/scholarship-progress#ac12282
history.subject: Can you P/NP entire schedule for last semester in Berkeley?
